name: Basic Survival Kit
description: Basic Survival Kit Includes - Essential VAAAPP vaporizer w/ 8 empty Vials - Artisan Distilled Essential Oils: Lavender, Ravensara, Rosemary - Himalayan Salt Rocks (hand-held size) - 50 Empty gelatin capsules (veggie caps MELT) - E-mailed or Printed document of Essential Oil uses on Playa It's CRUCIAL to bring your own electrolytes (Himalayan Salt Rocks), stay hydrated (Rosemary is great!), watch sun exposure levels, treat burns and balance your action with relaxation (lavender). Most important, watch that dust and keep those lungs open (Ravensara + Vaporizer). This intention was completed with the Basic Survival Kit. Basic Survival (3 oils) ~ $111 Lavender 10 mL Ravensara 5 mL Rosemary 10 mL 50 Gelatin Capsules ~ Summary of Gratitude ~ Being unable to join my tribe on the playa this year, I wanted to make sure everyone has access to my offerings on playa: superior oral tooth care products, artisan distilled essential oils, Essential VAAAPP vaporizers, natural electrolytes to optimize their experiences in the intensive conditions at Black Rock City. IMPORTANT: Upon receipt, transfer Mouthwash from the plastic bottle into a glass bottle - before entering the playa (excessive heat conditions)! Orders must be received by Friday, August 16th to be shipped, ready and received for Burning Man! Note: a designer box for your oils IS NOT INCLUDED & must be sourced separately if desired! DETAILED SUMMARY LIST Lavender 10 mL - Great for burns, apply undiluted for sunburns. Calms the nervous system, a few drops in a capsule taken internally and make sleep come easier. Ravensara 5 mL - Crucial for highly dusty area - Use 1 drop in a vaporizer as needed. Similar to a natural "Vicks Vapor Rub", great for colds, flus. Apply on topically to speed the recovery of a herpes outbreak (source un-verified?, practical experience has been observed). Rosemary 10 mL - Apply on temples with brief 5 second massage for alertness AND may abort headaches. Infuse 1 drop into 8-16 ounces of water, great for hydration - add in some himayalan salt/electrolytes. Himayalan Salt Rock - Lick as needed for electrolytes. Some individuals report that water tastes sweet directly after licking salt if they are dehydrated or deficient in electrolytes. Essential VAAAPP Vaporizer - Dynamic tool for ingesting various nutritional supplements using the inhalation pathway - oils, concentrates, powders, plant materials are all viable options for use with the Essential VAAAPP! For the Playa, relevant essential oils infused into vaporizer: Ravensara - "opens up the lungs" - absolutely crucial, assists the respiratory pathway Lavender - "relax" - pleasant flavor, calms nervous system down, relaxes muscles

name: SurThrival Kit

Most important, watch that dust and keep those lungs open (Ravensara + Vaporizer). This intention was completed with the Basic Survival Kit This SurThrival package is my recommended selection, balancing value, cost and the wide access of tools. Adds in my oral tooth care products while supplies/batches last (Dr. Nick's Tooth Oil Roll-On & Magick Mouthwash) for ease of tooth care on playa without running water or grey water concerns. Along with the contents of Basic Survival you have nice balanced grounding oils (ie. Cedar Atlas), elevated mood enhancers like Bitter Orange or Clary Sage, anti-infective (thyme/oregano), digestive aids (peppermint), Tulsi (Holy Basil) for manifestation and attracting positive experiences on/off the playa. Feeling sexy? Ylang-ylang... SurThrival Kit Includes (10 oils) ~ $222 Bitter Orange 10 mL Cedar-Atlas 5 mL Clary Sage 5 mL Lavender 10 mL Oregano or Thyme 5-10 mL Peppermint 10 mL Ravensara 5 mL Rosemary 10 mL Tulsi (Holy Basil) 10 mL Ylang-Ylang (Extra, #2 or Complete) 5-10 mL ~ Summary of Gratitude ~ Being unable to join my tribe on the playa this year, I wanted to make sure everyone has access to my offerings on playa: superior oral tooth care products, artisan distilled essential oils, Essential VAAAPP vaporizers, natural electrolytes to optimize their experiences in the intensive conditions at Black Rock City. The SurThrival & Plush Kits include Dr. Nick's Tooth Oil Roll-On and Magick Mouthwash (as supplies last). IMPORTANT: Upon receipt, transfer Mouthwash from the plastic bottle into a glass bottle - before entering the playa (excessive heat conditions)! Orders must be received by Friday, August 16th to be shipped, ready and received for Burning Man! Note: a designer box for your oils IS NOT INCLUDED & must be sourced separately if desired! DETAILED SUMMARY LIST Bitter Orange - Mood enhancing, natural drink flavoring agent. Body euphoria, tingling in extremities and CNS. I enjoy encapsulating 5-10 drops and taking capsule orally. Do not ingest essential oils undiluted without a capsule. Cedar, Atlas - Considering all possible fragrances, if I had a daily scent to WEAR - this would be it! Soft, buttery, creamy - a gentle masculine energy, almost feminine in nature. Grounding when vaporized, excellent when mixed with citrus in the Essential VAAAPP. A nice addition to bring back to center during difficult experiences (emotionally). Clary Sage - Reduces cramps, clearly euphoric, calms mood, applied topically or internal ingested for PMS symptoms. Very effective, strong euphoria when vaporized. Great for tea, drinks and shared! Lavender - Great for burns, apply undiluted for sunburns. Calms the nervous system, a few drops in a capsule taken internally and make sleep come easier. Oregano or Thyme - High levels of thymol/carvacrol. Very anti-microbial, nice anti-spasmodic. Taken internally during times of infection, or make a hot tea. Do not put on skin without professional supervision, will burn! These oils (esp. oregano) can affect normal gut flora - only take when feeling ill! VERY HARSH when vaporized, I don't recommend this to anyone... (though I have personally found it to be effective for respiratory infections). Peppermint - Uplifting, digestive aid, mind-stimulating. Applied topically for headaches, may be abortive. Ravensara - Crucial for highly dusty area - Use 1 drop in a vaporizer as needed. Similar to a natural "Vicks Vapor Rub", great for colds, flus. Apply on topically to speed the recovery of a herpes outbreak (source unverified?, practical experience has been observed). Rosemary - Apply on temples with brief 5 second massage for alertness AND may abort headaches. Infuse 1 drop into 8-16 ounces of water, great for hydration - add in some himayalan salt/electrolytes. Tulsi (Holy Basil) - Grown in India - said no negative energy exists in this plant's auric field. Attracts more positive energy & experiences into your life! Phenomenal when vaporized, mood enhancing when infused into hot water for tea (1-2 drops in 8-16 ounces of water - let sit for 5 minutes while stirring before drinking) Ylang-Ylang (Extra, #2 or Complete) - Sweet, sexy. Great for: opening up the heart, jealousy issues, moderate aphrodisiac properties (effective at 4 drops in a capsule OR 1-2 drops each day for several days). Wonderful in drinks (8-16 ounces of water/drop), can be worn slightly diluted (feminine). Himayalan Salt Rock - Lick as needed for electrolytes. Some individuals report that water tastes sweet directly after licking salt if they are dehydrated or deficient in electrolytes. Essential VAAAPP Vaporizer - Dynamic tool for ingesting various nutritional supplements using the inhalation pathway - oils, concentrates, powders, plant materials are all viable options for use with the Essential VAAAPP! For the Playa, relevant essential oils infused into vaporizer: Bitter Orange - "Tingly Warm" Cedar, Atlas - "Grounding" Clary Sage - "Clearly Euphoric" Lavender - "relax" - pleasant flavor, calms nervous system down, relaxes muscles Ravensara - "opens up the lungs" - absolutely crucial, assists the respiratory pathway Rosemary - "mind-stimulating" Tulsi - "positive smiles" Ylang Ylang - "sexy" - sweet, exotic - very warming and inviting for play

name: Essential Oil Wizardry Playshop Admission Ticket
description:
Admission for 1 Essential Oil Wizardry (EOW) Experience

Each gathering takes place in a unique city to serve local communities with empowerment of wellness using essential oils.  All tickets are electronic and online tickets may be purchased up to 48 hours before the event.

Listing of Essential Oil Wizardry Playshops

July 7th, 2013: Sedona, AZ
Location: Sedona Karate Academy
215 Coffeepot Dr., Suite A
Sedona, AZ 86336

Playshop Includes Combination of the Following:
Basic Info on Essential Oils Safety and Application
Discuss +/- 20 Artisan Distilled EO’s
Discussion of “Intelligent Alchemy”
Clean your palette with Dr. Nick's Natural Tooth Oil and Magick Mouthwash
Education on homemade salves
Homemade sodas/elixirs
Vaporize Essential Oils using medical vaporizers (with guidance)

Experience may include (set/setting/time dependent):
Vegan EO infused lunch or snack
Immersive Essential Oil Infused Chocolate Experience
Sacred Hydrosol Ceremony

All Attendee’s will Receive:
Gifted bottle of essential oil for each attendee (to continue the magick at home!)
Offer for reduced cost vaporizers ($50) offered and valid for 24 hours at the end of event

~ All presented by the most awesome pharmacist ever! ~ 
by Dr. Nick Berry (www.DrNickBerry.com)

name: Essential VAAAPP Complete Kit (8 Spare Vials + 1 Artisan Distilled Essential Oil)
description:
1 Essential VAAAPP Vaporizer (Color Variable)
8 Spare Vials
1 Artisan Distilled Essential Oil

Artisan Distilled Essential Oil varies in volume dependent on availability of stock & type of essential oil. Please select one of the following Essential Oils with volumes included as listed :-)

Blood Orange (Israel) ... 5 mL
Lavender Mailette (France) ... 5 mL
Lemon Hydrodistilled (South Africa) ... 5 mL
Ravensara (Madagascar) ... 2.5 mL

Benefits: Inexpensive, great for manually vaporizing essential oils and concentrations. Portable, easy to use. Very versatile contraption and easy to clean (soak in rubbing alcohol and/or sea salt).

Drawbacks: Better alternatives for vaporizing raw plant material. Clean or replace vials after usage. Cannot verify specific heating temperature through manual heating process.

name: Synchro Genesis (1 Pound Bag)
description:
A truly revolutionary food for the intense demands of life in the information age, Synchro Genesis is a unique blend of high-quality, plant-based proteins and the most nutrient-dense and powerful superfoods the world has to offer. The idea behind Synchro Genesis is simple: the body performs better when fueled by nutrient-dense foods.  The ingredients in Synchro Genesis were carefully selected to work in synergy to support metabolism, boost energy levels and encourage the formation of lean muscle. Occasional use of Synchro Genesis is powerful; consistent use is genuinely transformative.

~ Jedi SuperFood ~

name: Bitter Orange Essential Oil (10 mL)
description: Citrus x aurantium Cool citrus fresh pep uplifting the nose and envigorating the senses, slightly sour in its expression. Bright, zesty, and cheery flavor ~ - Digestive balance (constipation, diarrhea, heartburn) - Anti-fungal (topical use): NOTE, avoid applying undiluted lotions or wearing citrus oils for prolonged periods of sun exposure – serious potential phototoxicity [sunburn] - Stimulant (relaxation also possible) - Anti-septic - Mood enhancement - Weight loss (paradoxical appetite stimulation possible) - Fatigue Dr. Nick Notes Citrus aurantium tree is native to tropical Asia and East Africa although is grown in Mediterranean regions, and parts of the US. Citrus aurantium is processed to produce three lovely essential oils, each resulting from different parts of the tree. Bitter orange oil is typically produced using a cold-press method using the peels of the bitter orange. Petigrain oil is produced using the twigs and leaves of the bitter orange tree, while Neroli oil is produced from the blossom of the bitter orange. Also known as sour orange or zhi shi, bitter orange has been used in Chinese medicine as a digestive aid as well as a stimulant, decongestant, and bronchodilator in other alternative medicine practices. Topically applied, it has also been used as an anti-fungal agent for ring worm, jock itch, or athlete’s foot. I enjoy using bitter orange oil as a cocktail spritzer, in huge kales or salad (single drop application). The uplifting, smiley properties are rather awesome while having applications in the social setting at larger doses. Personally I enjoy about 5-10 drops taken internally in a capsule for social lubrication for the warm, fuzzy experience bitter orange oil produces. The comparison frequently is likened to a light-to-moderate dose of an entactogen without a crash. The dose stated may be higher than necessary and I am unsure of this dose’s safety for other individuals, especially with regular usage. The author is not recommending this usage for others but personally appreciates this application when timing aligns. Some successful reports for clinical applications have included suppression of appetite for patients with desire to lose weight. This oil can be used for mood elevation and should not be used when driving. Never apply this or other citrus oils before entering sunlight as an elevated risk for phototoxicity exists. Wait at least 2 hours before stepping into the sun for prolonged exposure. Simple uplifting citrus fragrance, add to spray bottle as an anti-microbial room freshener. How to Use Use aromatically in room diffuser or diluted in a spray bottle. Never apply topically undiluted, may cause irritation in some individuals. Stay out of sunlight or risk burn! Nice additive in food/drink at appropriate dilutions. Never use more than one or two drops. Delicious vaporized in an Essential VAAAPP at 1 drop using standardized oil vaporization technique for approximately 3-5 seconds. Notes: Organic Origin: Egypt Volume: 10ml Terpenes (major >90%): d-limonene, myrcene, pinene, ocimene, p-cymene. Alcohols: linalool, terpinene, nerol, farnesol, nerodilol, octanol. Aldehydes: decanal, nonanal, dodecanal, citronellal, neral acetaldehyde. Ketones: carvone, α-ionone, jasmone. Acids: octadecadienoic, pelargonic, cinnamic, acetic. Esters: linalyl acetate, geranyl acetate. Coumarins: osthole, auraptenol. ~ Be Blessed ~ References: - National Center of Complementary and Alternative Medicine (NCCAM). Herbs at a glance. Bitter Orange. http://nccam.nih.gov/health/bitterorange - Web MD. description: Foeniculum vulgare Fennel is used as a widely as a digestive aid, tooth care & cosmetic products internationally ~ one of nature's sweet versatile medicines. - Anti-septic - Anti-Spasmodic - Appetite Suppressant (?) - Carminative - Calms Stomach - Digestive Aid - Flavoring Agent - Natural Insecticide - Natural Preservative - Skin Tonic (must dilute) Dr. Nick's Blessings Fennel has been an ally on the road, working with the public & through Conscious Bartending. This sweet oil infuses life-force into drinks and plays well with other oils, while providing the drinker a more settled stomach. When my stomach feels uneasy, this tends to me my first choice go-to: both for gas, abdominal pain. Fennel is used in many of my oral care combinations (ie. Dr. Nick's Tooth Oil, mouthwash) and adds well to foods (ie. chocolate, non-dairy/dairy ice cream) to promote ease in the digestive system. Haven't tried yet, but I'm sure it can add value to salads & stir-fries in the appropriate dilutions (1 drop to large salads/stir-fry). When diluted and swished, fennel seems to provide a "clean" experience in the mouth/teeth which may contribute to it's wide use in commerically available oral care products. With the right dilutions, the fennel has an uplifting tonic property to topical skin use. An inexpensive ally, sweet fennel oil is a great investment to have in your toolbox. How to Use Must DILUTE before topical application. Oral ingestion is not recommended without consulting a trained practitioner or under a physician's care. ~ Be Blessed ~ Notes: Organic Origin: France Volume: 10 mL Terpenes: anethole, fenchone References: http://www.ars-grin.gov/cgi-bin/duke/ http://vcampus.uom.ac.mu/upload/public/2003122103128.pdf http://www.livestrong.com/article/397356-fennel-essential-oil-benefits/#ixzz2LZyYHx7f "Journal of Medicinal Food"; Antimicrobial Activities of Essential Oil and Hexane Extract of Florence Fennel Against Foodborne Microorganisms; B. name: Lavender Essential Oil (mL Varies)
description: Lavandula angustifolia Enveloped and floating on a cloud of floral amethyst sweetness, lavender oil transports an individual to a world of relaxation and restful dreams. - Aids in wound healing - Anti-microbial - Anxiety - Autoimmune hair loss (Alopecia Areata) - Burns - Headaches - Head lice - Insomnia - May decrease Blood Pressure (see Dr. Nick’s Notes) - Pain relief Dr. Nick Notes Often referred to as the “Swiss Army Knife” of essential oils; a cure-all ~ Fragrant cloud of violet bliss sweeps away angst, anger and attitude. Great for calming emotions and applying on topically for wounds, undiluted. Excellent for relaxing children, rubbed directly onto the bottom of feet before bed. This is one essential oil which is not irritating applied during to the skin (applied “NEAT”). Lavender oil should be kept in everyone’s mobile medicine chest. Rubbed into the temples, lavender may abort a headache in a short period of time (try combining with Rosemary or Peppermint oils). This can be added into Dr. Bronner’s to create a relaxing soap or cleaning solution or 15 drops/oz into a massage oil. Add into Red Raspberry Leaf oil for a homemade sunscreen moisturizer. Wonderful vaporized in an Essential VAAAPP for a relaxing treat or added into some foods at appropriate concentration (1-2 drops). EO aficionados will find a depth of variety in the world of lavender ranging from fluffy amethyst clouds, pungent violet fragrance, to a potent anti-microbial lung stimulating oil. Many different varietals of lavender are harvested, distilled and used around the globe (ie. Spike Lavender, Lavendin, Lavender, etc). Different varietals may have more concentrated benefits of anti-microbial vs. relaxation properties. Lavender is one of the most widely used essential oils today and can be found in baked goods, candles, cosmetic products, detergents, massage oils, perfumes, powders, soaps and teas. There are many different type of lavender although English lavender (Lavandula angustifolia) is the most common. Others include L. burnamii, L. dentate, L. dhofarensis, L. latifolia, and L. stoechas. How to Use Diffuser: Place 1-2 drops to create a relaxing ambience at home, the workplace, or anywhere else a calming effect is desired. You can also place a drop or two on a cotton ball for similar effects. Essential VAAAPP: Place 1 drop inside clean glass VAAP vial. Apply flame one inch below the oil inside vial. Heat for approximately 3-5 seconds – you should NOT see smoke. Inhale as directed for a violet dream of relaxation. Enjoy at bedtime. May also be used during anxious moments… efficient delivery system into bloodstream immediately as noted in smoking/vaporizing absorption. Migraine/Headache: Place 1-2 drops on area above the lip directly underneath nose (avoid placing oil inside nasal cavity & keep out of eyes) Topical pain massage: Place 1-2 drops lavender oil per 5ml carrier lotion or oil. Massage affected area as needed. This pain potion can be used for sore or crampy muscles including but not limited to menstrual cramping. Can be used neat (undiluted), non-irritant. Notes: Organic or Wildcrafted Origin: Varies (see drop down menu) Volume: 10ml Terpenes: linalool, linalyl acetate, camphor, borneol, terpinene, 1,8-cineol, pinene, limonene, perilyl alcohol. ~ Be Blessed ~

name: Nutmeg Essential Oil (10 mL)
description: Myristica fragrans Warming fragrance which stimulates an inner joy and provides a layer of mysticism with its rich usage. - Aids in blood circulation - Aphrosdisac - Arthritic pain - Carminative (reduces gas) - Constipation - Digestion - Fatigue - Mood Enhancer - Mental Stimulant Dr. Nick Notes Such a lovely oil, one of my favorites to use at social gatherings during late nights and epic gatherings - especially wonderful during dancing. Why? The fragrance is pleasant, playful and inviting for opportunity. Rubbed into a carrier oil and applied to the skin, a warm tingling sensation may be experienced. I find that this fuzzy-warmth is intensified through dancing & heating the body ~ Stop dancing, tingling subsides. Love this oil as a social lubricant! Absolutely wonderful as an playful odorizer or spicy fragrance on the body. Diluted in carrier oil, Nutmeg is great for rubbing onto sore muscles, arthritic joints or physical areas of stuck energy. Let me be very clear, I strongly discourage any internal ingestion of nutmeg oil due its hepatotoxic effects. While in Peru, I met a traveler who had successfully battled liver cancer who laid it's possible infliction due to intentional consumption of high dose nutmeg in his teenage years. Not for vaporization or internal consumption - see detailed WARNING below. How to Use Recommended for use with a trained practitioner or under a physician's care. DILUTE appropriately before topical application and take care in sensitive individuals - do a small skin test to assure an irritation-free experience. Internal ingestion is not recommended as dose of toxicity for nutmeg oil is undetermined. WARNINGS: Myristicin and elemicin (both found in Nutmeg oil) are strong anti-cholinergic agents which pose danger in high amounts. Fabled reports of intentional ingestion of 20+ grams of nutmeg can lead to hallucinations, dry mouth, excitation and confusion with bloodshot eyes and dampered memory. When high doses are ingested, the effects can take several hours for onset and can last several days. Nausea, vomiting, tachycardia, dizziness and anxiety are other symptoms of nutmeg poisoning. Think of intentional ingestion of high doses of nutmeg to be equivalent to a liver toxic multiple day Datura nightmare. I stay away from internal ingestion of nutmeg oil and strongly suggest you do the same! ~ Be Blessed ~ Notes: Organic Origin: Sri Lanka Volume: 10 mL Terpenes: trimyristin, myristicin, elemicin, eugenol, safrole. Others include pinene, camphene, dipentene, cineole, linalool, sabinene, terpeniol, cymene, alpha-thujene, gamma-terpinene References: http://www.ars-grin.gov/cgi-bin/duke/ http://www.drugs.com/npp/nutmeg.html http://www.nutrition-and-you.com/nutmeg.html * These statements have not been evaluated by the Food and Drug Administration. name: Oregano Essential Oil (mL Varies)
description: Origanum vulgare This phenomenal Greek oregano extract offers some of nature's most potent anti-microbial, anti-fungal and anti-parasitic properties in each drop owing to its naturally high carvacrol & thymol levels. - Anti-"everything" (fungal, microbial, parasitic, viral) - Anti-histamine - Anti-spasmodic (?) - Anti-tumor (??) - Clears mucous - Cramps - Prevents Free Radical Damage to Cells (ie. thymol) - Insect Repellant (Wish I knew this in Peru!) - Stomach Upset Dr. Nick Notes This is one of the most valuable oils I have access to and I have incredible gratitude for receiving such POTENT tools into my access point. Two years ago, during winter my health was declining for approximately 1.5 weeks until wheezing & loss of breath was quite apparent around the clock and determined it was time - I NEEDED to see a doctor for antibiotics. Hopeless, I experimented with a vaporizer during a self-diagnosed third consecutive year of pneumonia using 1 drop of oil of oregano. After vaporizing 1 drop of oregano oil three times on day 1 and twice on day 2, my respiratory system felt about 85-90% of baseline at the end of the 2nd day. This experience enlightened me to the dynamic creativity involved in medicine & healing. Let me be very clear, I don't recommend anyone inhale oregano or take it internally undiluted as it is a strong irritant due to its high concentration of phenolic groups. I coughed up nasty gunk from deep in my lungs for up to 5 minutes and getting the temperature "correct" can be a challenge (warmer = more irritating). After the coughing spell came a wave of peace & clarity. Since then, I use oil of oregano vaporized at the onset of flu/cold symptoms, sore throats or 1 drop diluted in hot water as a tea for food poisoning/upset stomach which generally self-corrects in 1-3 hours when I take it quickly after onset. Recently I've been told that women take oregano tea for their cramps during menses though I haven't had direct experience with that suggestion. This is an anti-infective powerhouse with high quantity & quality of research information demonstrating it's effectiveness - check it out on Pubmed yourself & be blessed :-) How to Use NOTE: Avoid with strong liver disease and do not use undiluted! Oregano should ALWAYS be diluted in appropriate concentrations as it is too potent for all membranes/skin both internal/external without dilution. Some patients dilute this into lotions or oils for topical fungal infections. To drink, use about 8-16 ounce of hot water, mix 1 drop of oregano oil, stir for about 3 minutes before smelling potent fumes (irritating) and enjoy! I won't recommend vaporizing this for others as it's a strong irritant, though it has been quite effective systemically through this mechanism for me, after the coughing spell. Notes: Organic Origin: Greece, Morocco, Hungary Volume: 5-10 mL Terpenes: Carvacrol, gamma-terpinene, p-cymene, myrcene, a-pinene, B-caryophyllene, Thymol ~ Be Blessed ~ References: http://www.ars-grin.gov/cgi-bin/duke/ Schmidt, E., J. name: Palo Santo Essential Oil (10 mL)
description: Bursera graveolens Palo Santo translates to Sacred Wood and is used in various ceremonies and revered by shamans for purposes of cleansing, clearing negative energies or detoxifying. - Anti-tumor (high limonene %) - Anti-microbial (highly) - Anti-inflammatory - Clearing Negative Energies - Grounding - Immunostimulant - Meditation Aid - Sedative Dr. Nick Notes Palo Santo provides a high vibration oil, a seemingly pressed concentrate from the dried wood essence which is typically lit to release it's cleansing fragrance. Vaporizing Palo Santo oil brings a clarity into the mind's eye, relaxing the system with a cool overindulgence of sweet flavor. Heating the oil softens an area and prepares participants for ceremony. The fragrance of the Palo Santo wood comes from the inside out - when the tree dies, the fragrance from the wood shifts into a sweet, radiant concentrated scent over about two years. As the dead wood ages, the fragrance matures - real Palo Santo must naturally die and age to release its highest form of fragrance. With increased age since a tree's passing, the quality improves (ie. 10 years). Nature really knows how to provide her own essence best! How to Use Palo Santo vaporized is a sweet, Earthy dream leading into a calm meditative space. Applied topically NEAT (with care, may cause negative reaction) or 1:1 in carrier oil over third eye or heart can ground body and relax the system. Origin: Peru Volume: 10 mL Terpenes (highest to low): Limonene, a-Terpineol, Menthofuran, Carvone, Germacrene D, y-Muurolene, trans-Carveol, Pulegone ~ Be Blessed ~ References: GC/MS Terpene Analysis from http://www.ecuadorianhands.com/-i-35.html. name: Peppermint Essential Oil (10 mL)
description: Mentha piperita Phenomenal flavoring agent (ie. ice cream, desserts, drinks) and digestive aid, peppermint provides versatile supportive care with one cool punch! - Acne - Carminative (reduces gas) - Digestive Aid - Expectorant - Flavoring Agent - Stress Reducer - Topical Analgesic (Minor Pain) - Used in Oral Care Products Dr. Nick Notes This peppermint oil is somewhat sweet and very high quality! Peppermint oil frequently adds value in Conscious Bartending - this oil packs on much flavor while easing the stomach and stimulating the mind simply combined with water. Peppermint tends to subtly wake a person, can quite well combines with other flavorful digestive oils (ie. star anise, fennel, cardamom). This oil adds value to many dessert(s) with appropriate dilution, (ie. coconut milk ice cream, brownies). If vaporized, low temperatures should be used - peppermint is a great light "pep"-er treat. Opens the lungs and invigorates the mind ~ peppermint is a prime ingredient in my mouthwash concentrates and is used in many oral care products in the market. Rubbed into the temples may assist with stress and calm the body. How to Use Excellent to use in appropriate dilutions (ie. 1 drop 8-16 ounces H2O), try putting 1-2 drops in a pint of non-dairy ice cream (ie. vanilla coconut milk ice cream) or on brownies. Great digestive tea, 1 drop in 16 ounces of hot water, stir for 3 minutes before smelling/drinking. Dilute into carrier oil, apply to chest to loosen phlegm and cool lungs. Can be rubbed onto bottom of feet or rubbed onto temples to assist with headache. Peppermint may be too intense for direct vaporization. name: Ravensara Aromatica (5 mL)
description: Ravensara aromatica Experienced as a cool, mild, and crisp winter breeze; opens the throat and lungs to ease breathing. Ravensara aromatica is antiviral, and provides a clear euphoria making it a perfect tool for combatting respiratory congestion or preparing the body for aerobic exercise. - Anti-viral - Congestion - Enhances massage oils - Respiratory expansion - Steam baths (+++ Experience) Dr. Nick Notes Ravensara aromatica is described as a natural mentholatum product without any of the petroleum additives. This EO has true anti-viral properties in addition to true bronchodilatory effects. Through practical experience, case reports state increased ease of breathing for conditions including asthma & COPD – this is NOT a cure, but perhaps another tool to utilize concurrently amongst other respiratory treatment options. Ravensara is said to have anti-viral properties. Topically applied directly onto cold sores or herpes simplex, healing speed may increase. May dilute into carrier oil for an aromatic massage oil, great for massages during flu season. Enjoy adding this to massage oil for a eucalyptus-like tingle – apply to chest, neck & lymph during times of colds/flus. Phenomenal to use with an Essential VAAAPP – my favorite usage of Ravensara. One heated inhalation opens up the lungs and eases respiration. Can make disposable vaporizer using certain coffee cups w/ lids - fill with hot water and add several drops of ravensara. ~ RavINTsara vs. Ravensara? ~ Ravensara aromatica, an evergreen member of the lauraceae family, is native to Madagascar and has an interesting and controversial taxonomic history. Often confused (even by prominent aromatherapists) as being synonymous with Ravintsara, it’s now appears they are two distinct entities. Ravintsara is not native to Madagascar and is a non-camphor producing chemotype of a Chinese tree named Cinnamonum camphora that was introduced to Madagascar in the 19th century. Ravintsara has been hypothesized to have lost its ability to produce camphor due to the tropical Madagascan climate. While Ravintsara is high in 1,8-cineole (eucalyptol), Ravensara aromatica contains very little 1,8-cineole. Nevertheless, due to confusion over the species they’ve been used similarly in folk medicine and Ravensara oil is often contaminated with Ravintsara and vice versa (Juliani et al 2006). How to Use To fight cold and congestive symptoms, a few drops of Ravensara aromatica can be added to a hot bath. Add a drop or two to a cup of hot water then close your eyes and place a warm towel over your head to trap in vapor. Inhale deeply for 10 minutes three times daily to ease breathing. VAAAPP appropriately anytime you feel the need for ease of breathing. OR try making a water vaporizer using a coffee cup/lid with hot water [see YouTube Essential Oil Wizardry video for instruction on making your own disposable essential oil vaporizer]. Dilute in carrier oil for a topical massage to knock down colds and ease aching bodies. Try gentle massage over the front and back sides of the thorax region similar to applied areas of a vapor rub. Dilute appropriately in occlusive carrier such as cool temperature coconut oil or beeswax. Apply liberally and frequently to cold sore to hasten healing. Unknown whether this oil may be used once or twice daily as prophylactic chapstick/lip balm – try it and let us know if you have any benefits PREVENTING new cold sores with regular use! Try applying on shingles or chicken pox directly; applied neat or diluted in carrier oil. Notes: Wildcrafted Origin: Madagascar Volume: 5 mL Monoterpenes: Alpha-Pinene, Sabinene, Myrcene, Limonene, 1,8-cineole (minor) & azulene [Iso-ledene] ~ Be Blessed ~ References: Juliani HR, Kapteyn J, Jones D, Koroch AR, Wang M, Charles D, Simon JE. name: Rosemary Essential Oil (10 mL)
description: Rosmarinus officinalis "Sun" herb describes its bright properties: enlivens the mind and uplifts mood while stimulating digestion & hydrating the body; a multi-faceted medicine to keep on hand! - Analgesic (?) - Assists in Respiratory Issues - Astringent - Bronchitis - Calms Nerves - Carminative - May Improve Cognition Function (see references) - Digestive Aid - Mood Enhancer - Skin Tonic - helps respiratory problems Dr. Nick Notes Rosemary is one herb which has spoken to me since my youth with a bush growing right outfront from my mother's home. During my alchemical studies with Paul & Micah, creators of "Al-Kemi" Spagyrics we did extensive work with multiple layers of rosemary extractions and I found the therapeutic properties to be quite pronounced. Appreciated for its internal & external properties, rosemary is one oil I use frequently. Stimulates the mood, clarifies the mind, promotes digestion and eliminates flatulence. Vaporized internally, the lungs open, freshen and mind becomes calm and clear. Some individuals with asthma have reported increased ease in their breathing patterns from vaporizing rosemary. Infused into water or drinks at 1-2 drops/8-16 ounces is a refreshing drink which feels highly hydrating. One drop of oil rubbed into the temples may have abortive qualities for some headaches. Great for stimulating circulation as a rubifacent and a great additive to oral care products for its anti-microbial properties. Internet sources claim rosemary oil can stimulate hair follicles though I cannot personally attest to this claim - may be interesting to experiment if I was losing my hair or having it thin. Science points to the therapeutic opportunities from Rosemary oil - Therapeutic Advances in Psychopharmacology published an article about a small open label study suggesting that rosemary can boost cognitive performance (memory, focus/concentration) with its elevated levels of 1,8-cineole in March 2012. Students may find a benefit by breathing in this oil during before studying or during a test :-) Rosemary oil carries cooling tonic effects and diluted in carrier oil can provide a moisturizing scrub or wash to the face with an enlivening tingle. Apply to sore muscles or stiff joints with the same oil for some possible relief. Rosemary anyone? How to Use Infuse 1-2 drops in 16 ounces of water or carbonated water for a hydrating drink. Add to a carrier oil (up to 15 drops/ounce) for a massage oil to sore joints, muscles. Rub diluted oil onto chest for respiratory challenges or onto stomach in clockwise direction with massage during digestive issues. Excellent vaporized at low temperatures, irritating at higher temperatures. Inhale in mornings to increase awareness and stimulate mood. Apply one drop "neat" to temples during headache for possible abortive properties. ~ Be Blessed ~ Notes: Organic Origin: South Africa Volume: 10 mL Terpenes: References: http://www.medscape.com/viewarticle/759506 http://www.ars-grin.gov/cgi-bin/duke/ http://www.ageless.co.za/herb-rosemary.htm * These statements have not been evaluated by the Food and Drug Administration. name: Thyme Essential Oil (mL Varies)
description: Thymus vulgaris Ranging from mildly quiet to a powerhouse of intensity depending on species, this oil has strong anti-microbial properties and owns the potential to increase oxygen to the mind. - Altitude Sickness - Anti-microbial (highly!) - Anti-spasmodic - Expectorant - Food Preservative - Insecticide - Mood Enhancer (Mild) - Stimulates Memory Dr. Nick's Blessings Thyme has been a powerful ally with its various chemotypes providing a multitude of characteristics towards wellness. Upon traveling to Peru, I used this oil frequently when eating food from street vendors and for adapting to altitude sickness. Thyme is said to assist with high altitudes, perhaps by increasing oxygen absorption into the brain. Amazingly enough when I traveled to Peru, I had virtually no noticeable differences when I flew from Lima (sea-level - 5,000 feet) to Cusco (~11,000 feet) which I attribute to multiple variables: lion's mane, cordyceps, reishi, coca tea on the plane & ingestion of thyme daily. My lack of physiological differences between the two locations was utterly astounding. Thyme is quite powerful due to it's high concentration of phenolic groups and comparative to oregano - several studies have analyzed use of thyme oil for preserving food (see links below). Vaporized, red thyme is rather harsh (similar to oregano, though powerful!) and combines well with oregano. I've found Thyme linalol to be quite smooth and effective for cough & cold, helping to expel gunk and clear the infestion. When I took 1-2 drops in 16 ounces of water at the onset (w/in 30 minues) of abdominal cramps (due to food poisoning), my health improved completely within about 2 hours. Using red thyme, 1 drop in 16 ounces of hot water while stirring and waiting 5 minutes before drinking (or smelling!) works wonders as a smooth medicinal drink. How to Use Thyme is quite powerful. Thyme linalool is smooth enough for vaporization and mixes well into water at dilutions of 1 drop/cup (8 ounces). Take care with the red thyme, it's considerably spicy and can irritate the mucosa if used at inappropriate concentrations! Home vaporizing: 1-3 drops of thyme in a small hot of boiling water. Close eyes and softly inhale the steam vapors. Consult a physician or aromatherapist before considering to use internally! Notes: See Options Below Origin: Varies, See Below Volume: Options Below Terpenes: 1,8-cineole, B-caryophyllene, car-3-ene, carvacrol, coumarin, gamma-terpinene, limonene, linalool, p-cymene, thymol ~ Be Blessed ~ References: http://www.ars-grin.gov/duke/ "Letters in Applied Microbiology"; Antibacterial Activity of Selected Plant Essential Oils Against Escherichia coli 0157:H7; Burt, SA and Reinders, RD; Vol. 36(3), 2003 "Food and Chemical Toxicology"; Enhanced bactericidal activity of enterocin AS-48 in combination with essential oils, natural bioactive compounds and chemical preservatives against Listeria monocytogenes in ready-to-eat salad.; Antonio CM et. al; September 2009 * These statements have not been evaluated by the Food and Drug Administration. description: Curcuma longa Popular spice from India, health claims of Curcumin (found in Turmeric) have become recently highlighted for it's anti-inflammatory and potent antioxidant effects. - Anti-inflammatory - Anti-microbial - Anti-tumor (?) - Anti-nociceptive (Reduces Pain) - Antioxidant - Cosmetic Additive (Pain, Inflammation or skin care) - Food Additive Dr. Nick Notes I worked with a dermatologist in Encino for a year who took only one supplement daily. He claimed that he was convinced from his research that people who eat turmeric live longer. "This is why people who live in India have such long life spans" as curry & turmeric is a common spice in their foods. This oil is quite pronounced, quietly spicy and full of flavor. Turmeric EO will stain clothing and is quite viscous and sticky - I like adding 1-3 drops into a pot of veggie chili or large kale salad. Sometimes I add this to my morning smoothies or take a several drops internally in a capsule. It's difficult to quantify my experience in working with this oil as my usage is inconsistent. Love the flavor, the pugnent fragrance and how fresh it appeals. I've enjoyed adding a few drops into honey jars to really spice up the therapeutic benefits of honey! How to Use Wonderful to add 1-2 drops into tea, try combining with ginger and/or black pepper essential oil. Add into lotions/salves for increased health benefits (may stain skin). Great potent spice, use in foods! name: Ylang Ylang (Extra, Complete or #2) Essential Oil
description: Cananga odorata Flower so nice, they named it twice! Dripping with fragrance, an oil to relax and warm the senses from the inside out ~ great aphrodisiac! -Aphrodisiac -May regulate blood pressure -Aids in Meditation -Calms Body -Opens Heart -Settles Jealousy Issues (?) Dr. Nick Notes Ylang-Ylang is a ridiculous treat and one of my favorite essential oils to work with. Soft energy with a mild warming & sweet nectar appeal. Ylang-Ylang oil is great for meditation, relaxation, opening up the heart and said to settle jealousy issues. Commonly, I receive pleasurable responses to this oil both immediately and after reports with time - one of my quickest moving products! A powerful aphrodisiac: I find that when I drink 1-2 drops of ylang ylang oil infused into 16 ounces of water for 2-3 days, my sex drive increases about 50%. The flavor creates a phenomenal soda when added to carbonated water and infuses well into water ("Horny Water") at appropriate dilutions. Vaporized, the oil excites calmly and tantalizes taste buds. Strong fragrance and may be overpowering to sensitive individuals. This is a fractionally distilled oil which means the distillation is fragmented by different times for the extraction process - "Extra, 1, 2, 3, 4 and Complete". "Extra" carries most of the light & "fluffy" aromatic compounds, as it's the first portion of the flower released with lower volatization points - followed by 1, 2, 3, 4. "Complete" is a recombination of all the individual fractions to give a delicious full-spectrum representation of the oil. "2" is the third fraction separated and carries a slightly more mild balance of the aromatics compared to "Extra". My personal favorite is Ylang Ylang "Extra", followed by "Complete", then "2" - "2" tends to be my best seller, perhaps since its the most mild & gentle or for the lower expense. They are all fine oils and vary slightly in their characteristics. Notes: Organic Origin: Madagascar Volume: 5 or 10 mL References: http://www.ars-grin.gov/cgi-bin/duke/ ~ Be Blessed ~ * These statements have not been evaluated by the Food and Drug Administration. description: Rosa damascena Soothing rose water with a floral bouquet of grand proportions! - Acne - Aphrodisiac - Anti-Viral - Astringent - Calm Body/Mind - Clears Negative Energy - Relationship Issues - Tonic Dr. Nick Notes I've seen quite a number of rose oils (otto, damascena, white/pink) and several different waters. This is the first water I've been truly impressed by, gently carrying the vibration of the beautiful rose garden; truly floral! This is a extremely versatile solution, I spray it on my face or directly on my pillow before bed to aid in rest and refresh my face. 1-3 sprays in 4 ounces of water calms the mind, opens the heart and puts an epic smile on my face. It's fun to spray in willing crowds and receives adoring complements. Said to be anti-viral, try spraying on cold sores. Great refrigerated & sprayed! Definitely keep in a cool, dark place ~ Make sure not to freeze, as the solution will expand (I've broken some large fragrant bottles this way!) How to Use Spray into the air, into drinking water (1-3 sprays/4 ounces), directly onto the skin. Wonderful as a facial splash, body perfume, deodorant or air freshener. Try adding to lotions and creams :-) Hydrosols should be kept in a cool, dark place and optimally refrigerated (DO NOT FREEZE, can break glass). Excellent to combine with other fragrances for aromatic purposes: bergamot, chamomile, geranium, jasmine, lavender, lemon, mandarin, neroli, petitgrain, sandalwood, vetiver, ylang ylang ~ Be Blessed ~ Notes: Organic Origin: Bulgaria Volume: 30 mL * These statements have not been evaluated by the Food and Drug Administration. name: High Purity D-Limonene (>98.5%)
description: "High Purity" (>98.5%) D-Limonene **Extracted from Orange Peels** Very interesting solvent, removes gunk and tar as a cleaning agent. This is the highest quality D-Limonene on the market, ABOVE FOOD GRADE STANDARDS (>95%). This will be shipped in small bottles with droppers to easily add into water for home-friendly cleaners OR to drop into capsules. Clinical studies have evaluated safety and efficacy with D-Limonene have evaluated anti-tumor properties, treatment of GERD - check out www.Pubmed.gov for more research! Dr. Nick Notes D-Limonene is a VERY interesting compound to work with, both internally and externally. I will not be providing much information on using it internally, but the information is definitely out there. My first experience with D-Limonene was about 5 mL (~4 grams D-Limonene) shared in a large pot of miso soup. My partner in bliss that night was informed of the presence of D-Limonene, and not told of what the therapeutic effects were. After eating dinner, she commented on how great she felt. Next we both simulanteous spoke about how CLEAR we were... coincidence? D-Limonene is awesome - it's found in many OTC acne problems. I take small diluted amounts and rub it onto blemishes. Note that D-Limonene may be an irritant for sensitive individuals and I'm not recommending it's use topically. I will share that I have seen it shift bad acne into about 40-50% clear overnight when applied in small amounts undiluted. Using undiluted internally will irritate the mucosa and is not recommended. When using, I tend to put 1+ mL into capsules and take them internally: I find my mood increases, digestive processes speed up and life seems brighter. Phenomenal stuff! How to Use Skin-irritant, do not touch. Directions for Best Results: For all-purpose cleaning applications, mix 2-3 fl. oz of "High Purity" D-Limonene with 13-14 oz water in a 16 oz glass spray bottle. Once mixed with water, separation is natural. Always shake well before applying. For heavy stains and residue removal, use neat if necessary. Test all surfaces on hidden area before applying at full strength. Do not use on natural or synthetic rubbers or plastics. Avoid spraying near candles, open flames, or sources of ignition. Do your own research if you choose to take internally, I am NOT recommending your consumption of this.
